However, some of the puzzles were REALLY annoying to figure out. Luckily, the special edition has a hint system which make it much easier to beat.

185634295.review: Gran revisión de la versión original que ya fue una obra maestra en su tiempo. Decir que jugarlo es muy nostálgico se queda corto.

185625392.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed replaying this classic with clear graphics! It's near perfect, considering how great the original game was. The only things that slightly prevented a perfect score was the character model of Guybrush - sorry, I really don't like that shaved side of head look. If it was just like Wesley from the Princess Bride, that would be perfect. Some of the art takes a few liberties, which I understand and was completely necessary, but sometimes isn't as close to the original graphics design.

Also, when switching to classic mode, the voices were disabled. Now I know that the original floppy software didn't have voices, but since they use the original voices from the talkie CD version (a big plus using the original voices!), they could have given you the option to keep the voices or not when switching. Minor complaints, really. Overall I would highly recommend this remake!

185441296.review: Such a wonderful and enjoyable classic, and the fact that you can change to the original version at any time makes it even better!

185423297.review:
Really good special edition! I had played the original a number of times over the years, but it had been a long time when I loaded the special edition up. I had bought it quite a while back, but don't think I had actually played it through.

I loved the updated look, and the ability to switch to the original version on the fly is nice to see how the art style has been respected when they did this update.

If you like adventure games this is a absolute classic of the genre, and if you have never played an adventure game, I can't think of much of a better place to start than this updated version of one of the best games of the genre.

185293216.review: Playtime is skewed, left it on overnight by accident. Funny game with some neat 'a-ha!' puzzles. Some puzzles also a lil dated feeling.

185202681.review: For lack of time I just watched playthrough while commuting and I think creative ideas in/and writing of this game are so fun and great that I bought it just to recommend it, also special edition voice acting is superb!

184754572.review: Ein Spiel das echt spaß macht.. würde ich jedem der rätsel mag herzlichst empfehlen.. es gehört zu meinen lieblingsspielen

184707990.review:
The absolute classic and arguably best point and click adventure game was not done justice with this half cooked remaster. 

The updated soundtrack is great and it's good to see the cast from Curse come back and reprise their roles for the classic game in the series. Gameplay is very much the same. Where the remaster slips up is in the remastered character model designs and also, to a lesser extent, the environments. The characters and environments had such a charm and magic to them back in the day, the remaster style is very lifeless and bland in comparison. However, this remaster was released in 2009 so I can hardly expect modern day levels of detail here and i recall it being available on smart phones at the time which was pretty cool. I'm glad the ability to jump between old and new graphics is there but why is there not the option to play the old style graphics with the voices? Perhaps you can, I just didn't know how to activate it. This is just an old man rambling about the past, I don't think anyone new to the series will have a second thought about my issues with it. It is still a fantastic game.

Anyway, had a good time regardless revisiting this classic from my childhood with my own kid. He enjoyed it a ton. On to LeChucks Revenge..

184588539.review: This game is so creative and funny! The remastered version looks beautiful too! The only thing I will say about it is that it can be really difficult figuring out what to do. In the 20th century people would often share handwritten guides or rely on their friends to figure out what to do. Nowadays though, using a guide from the internet is kind of unavoidable at some points of the game

184557055.review: I have just finished playing The Secret of Monkey Island & LeChuck's Revenge (the second one - I will do a review on that game as well).  There is SO much to love about these remakes.  I played both at time of their original release (1990 & 1991 respectively).  I am pretty sure when I played The Secret of Monkey Island that it was the 16-colour version :D and by the time LeChuck's Revenge came out it was 256 colour VGA.  So, firstly, I really like how (in both games) you can press a key to instantly and seamlessly revert back to the original game (in The Secret, it reverts back to the 256 version, which is kind of a shame because I'd have liked to seen the 16-colour again, but no complaints).  The interface is VERY easy to use.  When I first started playing The Secret, I thought I wouldn't like the new graphics and interface but, in fact, I ended up LOVING the GUI and the graphics and artwork.  This is a delightful adventure that is lighthearted and jovial.  Unlike Sierra games (and, I love Sierra games, so this isn't a dis), you can't really die and there is no way (that I've discovered) that you can miss something that then triggers you to restore way back to much earlier in the game (this can happen in Sierra games, as there are certain puzzles whereby if you didn't get certain inventory items earlier on then you were simply screwed - hopefully you saved often!!).  The plot unfolds in a pleasing way and although there isn't a ton of character development amongst the characters, it doesn't detract from the game-play at all.  All-in-all, I am VERY pleased with this and it was made even more special because it was a Christmas gift from someone who knows my game tastes well :-)

184539749.review: Played this when i was younger and was still fantastic to replay again years later (female player). Good story, decent script. I love a good point and click and obscure puzzles. This version seemed more straight forward, but still got stuck a couple of times.

184455597.review: One of the Greatest Point and Click games out there.

184427833.review: Unforgettable: the visuals, the music, the story, the humor, the whole package.

184293558.review:
Cult classic beautifuly remastered. It let's you switch between old and new graphics mid game with only 1 key.
Interesting and challenging puzzles. Although sometimes it can be a bit hard to figure out what you are suposed to do next, so don'r be ashamed to look for a guide or use the help key. It still one of the most charming and funny games storywise and almost all dialogues are pure gold.

184285232.review: A fantastic game and one of the best point-and-clicks ever made! As someone who played the Telltale games in this series first, I was very excited to play the game that started it all and it did not disappoint! Humorous, engaging, fun, challenging, and that fantastic pirate-y world make for one of the best point-and-click games out there and an easy recommend.

184023778.review: good old game with great amount of all kind of puns.

183980826.review:
Ein Meisterwerk der Point and Click adventures. Ich hatte vorher nur Vollgas full throttle als Kind gespielt und etwas später Day of the Tentacle. Ich wusste zwar von Monkey Island jedoch ist es in Vergessenheit geraten. Als ich die Collection dann auf Steam entdeckt habe, wusste ich dieses Spiel bzw. die Reihe darf nicht unberührt bleiben. Und was soll ich sagen? The Secret of Monkey Island hat mich von Anfang bis Ende einfach nur gepackt. 

Es lädt einen dazu ein in das Spiel einzutauchen. Die Rätsel fordern kreatives Denken und sind sehr Unterhaltsam. Besonders hervorzuheben sind die humorvollen Dialoge die voller Wortwitz und Anspielungen stecken. Grundsätzlich ist der Humor das Herzstück des Spiels. Es nimmt sich nicht zu Ernst, überschreitet jedoch nicht die Grenze ins lächerliche. 

Die Atmosphäre ist durch detailreiche Szenenbilder sowie der tollen Musik sehr gut umgesetzt. Positiv möchte ich hervorheben, dass man einfach per Tastendruck zwischen der Grafik der Neuauflage und der Originalgrafik aus 1990 wechseln kann. So kann man sich die schönen Schauplätze aus einer anderen Perspektive ansehen. 

Fazit: Es ist ein Spiel, das zurecht Geschichte geschrieben hat und den absoluten Kultstatus genießt. Es bietet eine perfekte Mischung aus Abenteuer Humor und Rätseln. Ein Muss für jeden der in diesem Genre bereits Erfahrungen hat oder dieses Genre kennenlernen möchte. 

Ein Lob an die Entwickler. 10/10 !

183941060.review: Un clásico de los vídeo juegos con un lavado de cara, si te gustan las aventuras de texto, este juego es una obligación absoluta para ti. 7 de 10
